sense.name: a supply or source, a collection of something
sense.examples: The small company had depleted its reservoirs of cash within six months. The Internet has become a huge reservoir of information. Oil pooled in reservoirs between the layers of sedimentary rock.

sense.name: an artificial lake
sense.examples: Swimming and boating isn't allowed at the town reservoir. They built a dam and flooded the valley to make a new reservoir. This reservoir provides water to much of the northern part of the state.

sense.name: a storage tank for substances such as water, oil
sense.examples: A mysterious blast destroyed two petrochemical reservoirs near the harbor. The tall, brightly painted reservoirs could be seen from our airplane.

sense.name: a host site for an infectious agent
sense.examples: This species of bird serves as a reservoir for the virus. Epidemiologists are trying to determine what the reservoirs for this pathogen are.
